page.title: 15VILLAGE STUDY-EATON.
page.content: {FARMING}ACCORDING TO KELLY'S DIRECTORY OF NOTTINGHAMSHIRE FOR THE YEAR 1912 THERE WERE EIGHT FARMERS IN AND AROUND EATON VILLAGE.TODAY THE NUMBER IS LOWER;THE LAND IS OWNED,LEASED OR RENTED BY ONLY THREE.THIS SHOWS HOW FARM UNITS HAVE BECOME BIGGER DURING THIS CENTURY AND THIS,ACCOMPANIED BY FARM MECHANISATION,ACCOUNTS TO SOME EXTENT FOR THE DECLINING POPULATION OF THE VILLAGE.NOWADAYS THE FARMERS GROW MAINLY ARABLE CROPS SUCH AS POTATOES, SUGAR BEET AND BARLEY.HOWEVER NEAR THE RIVER THE LAND IS GRASS USED FOR GRAZING AND REARING CATTLE AND SHEEP.IN THE PAST THE VILLAGERS OF EATON GOT THEIR MILK FROM THE FARMER BUT TODAY,LIKE US IN RETFORD,IT COMES IN BOTTLES FROM THE DAIRY IN NOTTINGHAM.
